channel.title: Decompiling class files within a jar
channel.description: Today is the worst day of my project's development. I messed up my client and somehow messed up the backups. The only trace I have of an error free client is my client.jar. I understand there are many decompiling softwares; however, I've tried a few and they put some kind of weird JVM code through the classes and it just makes it even worse. I've even seen a program that actually changes some of the data within the classes. Does anyone know any type of software that will decompile class files 100% correctly without changing anything?

item.title: Decompiling class files within a jar
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

There are no decompilers that decompile 100% correctly. But Jad and Jode are good ones.

Next time use GitHub to manage versions of your server.

Read full topic
item.source: Decompiling class files within a jar
